intro: Schiedeella llaveana subsp. szlachetkoana, commonly known as the Mexican sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
